ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I absolutely adored this course. I have never been in a class that I did not want to end at the end of every session. I learned about what makes something new (as explained in the title), how inventions arise (which can occur in every day moments), and the history of newness in a wide variety of fields.

I learned so much about a variety of fields that are not typically discussed in one course. Reading philosophy, hearing student presentations on AI, block chains, animation, and more, were all insightful lessons that inspired deeper thinking and understandings of the idea of newness.
I learned how to think about creativity both from a practically as well as from a philosophical standpoint.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course's strength rested in Professor Gage's teaching style. Not solely is he brilliant and always has insightful remarks to share with the class, but the way he structured his course made it productive for everyone enrolled in it. Each class highlighted a new part of innovation, whereby newness was examined not just through students, but through incredible guest lecturer's, and assignments.
I love this class! No complaints -- Mark Foster Gage was incredibly approachable and always helped to create insightful class discussions.

A significant strength of this course is the way in which it is conducted regarding the many guest speakers we had who were all so successful in their own field and were able to give us a clearer idea of different ways innovation takes form.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I have already recommended this course to everyone I know given how exceptional it was. It is a hidden gem at Yale, for sure.
Yes, this is absolutely one of my favorite classes I have taken at Yale, everyone should take this course.

I would absolutely recommend this course to any other student regardless of their major. Anyone who is interested in the concept of the "new" will be greatly interested and engaged with all course and class material.
